author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Dollar Surges, Boosted By Sales Data And Rising Bond Yields
text:
The U.S. dollar surged Tuesday after strong retail-sales data boosted expectations for continued economic growth.
The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the currency against a basket of 16 others, rose 0.6% to 86.92. The dollar rose broadly, gaining 0.8% against the euro to $1.1837, 0.6% yen to Â¥110.347 per dollar and 0.4% versus the British pound to $13505.
